title: News this week: Start your Monday smart
text:
If your day doesn't start until you've gotten up to speed on the latest headlines, then let us introduce you to your new favorite morning fix. Sign up here for the '5 Things' newsletter.

Get '5 things' in your inbox

(CNN) Here's what you need to know to Start Your Week Smart .

(You can also get "5 Things You Need to Know Today" delivered to your inbox daily. You give us five minutes, and we give you five things you must know for your weekday, plus a Sunday edition to get your week started smart. Sign up here .)

TODAY

Whether you prefer an e-reader or old-fashioned paper and ink, find a cozy nook and an interesting yarn.

The Grand Slam's final face-off begins at 4 p.m. ET. Watch on ESPN

JUST WATCHED The 100 year history of the NFL Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH The 100 year history of the NFL 01:42

MONDAY

JUST WATCHED Late night comics slam Congress for inaction on gun violence Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH Late night comics slam Congress for inaction on gun violence 01:35

TUESDAY

• New iPhones are (probably) coming. Apple Apple is widely expected to unveil its latest iPhones, possibly including two "Pro" models with improved camera and video-recording features. Apple also could give final details and pricing for its streaming Apple TV+

JUST WATCHED Google finds evidence of attempted mass iPhone hack Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH Google finds evidence of attempted mass iPhone hack 01:43

• An election plays out after ballot tampering. The The last undecided contest of the 2018 midterms could be settled in a special election in North Carolina's 9th Congressional District. The vote redo follows the arrest of a campaign consultant over irregular and compromised absentee ballots. Democrat Dan McCready faces Republican Dan Bishop, along with Green and Libertarian party candidates.

JUST WATCHED North Carolina's House race is getting a do-over Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH North Carolina's House race is getting a do-over 02:55

• A Supreme Court justice offers his take. Neil Gorsuch Neil Gorsuch is due to discuss his book, "A Republic, If You Can Keep It," at the Reagan library in California as the tome hits store shelves

JUST WATCHED Roe v. Wade? Gorsuch says he values precedent (2017) Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH Roe v. Wade? Gorsuch says he values precedent (2017) 01:00

WEDNESDAY

• Americans remember 9/11. It's been 18 years since terror attacks left almost 3,000 people dead in New York, Washington and Pennsylvania. A ceremony It's been 18 years since terror attacks left almost 3,000 people dead in New York, Washington and Pennsylvania. A ceremony is scheduled at the 9/11 Memorial & Museum at the World Trade Center site. Communities and schools around the country also will pause to remember.

JUST WATCHED Jon Stewart chokes up, lectures Congress on 9/11 obligations Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH Jon Stewart chokes up, lectures Congress on 9/11 obligations 09:03

THURSDAY

JUST WATCHED Biden responds to candidates going after Obama in debate Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH Biden responds to candidates going after Obama in debate 00:56

FRIDAY

• Felicity Huffman gets sentenced. The "Desperate Housewives" star The "Desperate Housewives" star pleaded guilty to conspiring to pay $15,000 to a fake charity that facilitated cheating when her daughter took the SATs for college. Huffman, who's among dozens charged in the scam, is due to learn her fate. Prosecutors suggest four months in prison and a $20,000 fine.

JUST WATCHED How long could Felicity Huffman spend behind bars? Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH How long could Felicity Huffman spend behind bars? 01:19

• Politics may hit the runway. starts, less than seven weeks before the UK is due to leave the European Union. London Fashion Week starts, less than seven weeks before the UK is due to leave the European Union. Brexit could well step into the spotlight. Environmental protest is all but guaranteed, too.

JUST WATCHED Queen Elizabeth attends London Fashion Week (2018) Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH Queen Elizabeth attends London Fashion Week (2018) 00:58

• The King and Queen are coming!! The Crawley gang is back -- upstairs and down -- as the The Crawley gang is back -- upstairs and down -- as the much-awaited "Downton Abbey" movie hits UK theaters . It releases September 20 in the States.

JUST WATCHED Watch the trailer for the new 'Downton Abbey' movie Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH Watch the trailer for the new 'Downton Abbey' movie 01:01

SATURDAY

• A huge asteroid passes by Earth. It's taller than some of our planet's tallest buildings. Asteroid 2000 QW7's diameter might be as large as 2,132 feet. It'll be going 14,361 mph It's taller than some of our planet's tallest buildings. Asteroid 2000 QW7's diameter might be as large as 2,132 feet. It'll be going 14,361 mph when it zips within about 3 million miles of Earth at 7:54 p.m. ET.

JUST WATCHED US and Europe team up to protect Earth from asteroids Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH US and Europe team up to protect Earth from asteroids 01:19

• Anglers bestow a presidential honor. Another Another elite club will count former President George H.W. Bush as a member when the International Game Fish Association inducts the late 41st President into its hall of fame. A champion for sound fisheries policy, Bush enjoyed fishing trips well into his 90s

JUST WATCHED Young George H.W. Bush had plans for the future Replay More Videos ... MUST WATCH Young George H.W. Bush had plans for the future 01:52
description: Congress returns. Apple's reveal. Remembering 9/11. Felicity Huffman. Sunday Night Football. Neil Gorsuch's book. Here's what the next six days will bring.
